answers.answer: Too much t3 can be over-stimulating to the heart so we are cautious in dosing it -- this risk appears to increase with age.  That being said, liothyronine (t3) should be available in Europe readily -- ask at your local farmacia.  I usually combine t3 and t4 when using t3 so the current tiroide vister may be fine but likely needs closer monitoring -- ie check TSH to keep around 0.5-1.5 and be consistent with the dose.  The weight gain is likely in part thyroid but also after menopause there is an unfair slowing of metabolism -- the key is less calories in and more calories burned off.  A general endocrine evaluation to look at pre-diabetes (insulin resistance) or excessive cortisol (unlikely) may be appropriate.I would not recommend ordering meds from the internet unless you have a local doctor monitoring and prescribing the meds.
